definitions.definition: to move and make currents of air, or to be moved or make something move on a current of air:
examples: The wind was blowing harder every minute.

definitions.definition: to make a sound by forcing air out of your mouth and through an instrument, or to make a sound when someone does this:
examples: Ann blew a few notes on the trumpet.

definitions.definition: to blow air down a tube into a piece of heated soft glass, in order to shape it into an object:
to force air from your lungs and through your nose to clear it
to kiss your hand and blow on it in the direction of someone
a hard hit with a hand or a weapon:
examples: a sharp blow to the stomach
